div1.p: The enclosed photocopy of a letter from Mr. Diddock is so gracious that I thought you should have a copy. I'm sorry that I didn't have Mr. Diddock's letter in time to reach you while you were visiting your son in Phoenix, for I daresay you would have wished to see him. Perhaps you can call him the next time you are in Phoenix.

Lucile is at work on THE book and begrudges every minute that must be spent away from it. It will be a good book and I think--as scholarly books go--a bestseller. I would prefer to see a good university press--Nebraska perhaps--take it; but I am confident Lucile will have no difficulty finding a publisher.

You will be pleased to know that Dr. Folse is recovering from his illness. He is still quite feeble, however, and the physician advises removing him from the hospital to a convalescent facility before he comes home.
It was good to have you bless our household with your presence. You are always more than welcome here.
Best wishes to you, as always,
div1.closer:
Cordially,
Bower Aly
Professor of Speech cc: Mr. Joseph LaFlesche Diddock
